title: Former NBA Player Mike Dunleavy Jr. Lists Manhattan Apartment for Almost $7 Million
text:
Mike Dunleavy Jr., the former pro basketball player and newly minted assistant general manager of the Golden State Warriors, is ready to part with his Manhattan apartment, just in time for the start of the new NBA season.



Hitting the market for $6.99 million, the three-bedroom is within the Tribeca North Historic District, a designation that protects the historic integrity of the neighborhood known for its former industrial buildings and warehouses, most of which are now home to multimillion-dollar apartments.



More: Elijah Wood Lists Los Angeles Bungalows for Just Under $2M

Mr. Dunleavy Jr., 39, paid $4.5 million for the condo in 2011 using an eponymous trust in which he is listed as the sole trustee, property records show.



The “move-in ready” home spans 2,556 square feet and is centered around an open-plan living, dining and kitchen area complete with Caesarstone kitchen countertops, high ceilings and oversized casement windows, according to the listing with brokerage Douglas Elliman, who did not immediately respond to a request for comment.



The apartment’s three bedrooms include a master suite fitted with a custom walk-in closet and a spa-like bathroom.

Plus, outside is a roof terrace spanning more than 800 square feet and complete with seating areas and a basketball hoop.



The building, designed by BKSK Architects and built in 2004, has amenities such as a full-time doorman, a fitness center, a children's playroom and a common garden.



Mr. Dunleavy Jr., who could not immediately be reached for comment, played in the NBA for 15 seasons for a number of teams, including the Indiana Pacers, the Chicago Bulls and the Warriors. He retired in 2017.
